item.title: Request: Terms & Conditions page (Works like moparisthebest.com's)
item.dc:creator: @eclipse245 eclipse245
item.description:
@eclipse245 wrote:

[code]

1337scape Terms of Service body{font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;} div{background: #00CC00; width: 70%; border: 1px solid black; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;} input{border: 1px solid black;} untitled #sBar {text-align: center; margin: 0; margin-bottom: 10px; padding: 5px 0px; width: 728px; background-color: #fff; border: 1px solid #dfdfdf;} #sBar li {display: inline; } #sBar li a, #sBar li a:visited {font: bold 11px tahoma,arial; text-decoration: underline; color: #004891; margin: 0px 15px;}
1337scape Terms Of Service

If you type yes you must agree too all of the below:

You do not want to be here for fun, spam or anything, and are a part of Jagex.

These forums are for, 1337scape Development, which you can find help at, you must agree to all which is said, and respect others.


Wish to proceed? Please read all of these rules, and then you may!:

  1. Here at 1337scape we DO NOT talk about "rep".

  2. 1337scape has a spam section, so please keep it all in there, or you will be warned.

  3. We don't make spelling mistakes on purpose. We use "you" not "u", we use "why" not "y" and so on.

  4. We don't make posts that contain useless information. Posts like "cool", "lol", "yeah" and "I agree" don't contain anything useful for others. We are not fans of off topic, unless it contains something smart or funny. Most of things spammers find funny are actually not funny at all.

  5. No double posting, or bumping.

  6. NO ADVERTISING SITES\FORUMS UNLESS THE LINK IS APPROVED BY AN ADMINISTRATOR!

  7. We do not sell anything, for runescape cash, or any cash, except the server in game.

  8. We do not post keyloggers, or mask links leading to them!

  9. No posting nudity or highly violent pictures/words.

  10. No racism, it will lead to a one week mute, and if it continues a one month ban!

  11. No insulting respected members, or staff members.

  12. We do not ask for a staff position you will be chosen upon.

  13. Please follow all of these rules. I will add more, as the forums grow.

  14. Need more help? Try Http://google.com ! Or, another forum.



Type Yes to agree with the rules above.

Cookies must be enabled!!



[/code]

That’s the one for my 1337scape forums, You just change colors and what it says. And you have to type ‘yes’ and then Press I agree or Submit.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

YupolaScape:

Correct me if I’m wrong but wouldnt that make it automatically set the cookie without even agreeing?

No, the header/exit should stop the script before it sets the cookie if it hasn’t accepted already.

item.dc:creator: @ThatOneServer Mike_
item.description:
@ThatOneServer wrote:

[code]<?php
if(isset($_GET[‘tos’])) {
$_COOKIE[‘tos’] = $_GET[‘tos’];
}
if(strtolower() == “yes”) {
//site here
} else {
?>

<? } ?> [/code]

thats a start

item.title: Request: Terms & Conditions page (Works like moparisthebest.com's)
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:10, topic:161613”][quote author=VB7 Rocks link=topic=219934.msg1909398#msg1909398 date=1196581678]
That is like, an epic quote. First it’s funny, and second you don’t compile PHP.
[/quote]

I believe PHP scripts are compiled each time they are called. I’m not entirely sure how PHP parsers and cachers work, but I’m pretty sure PHP cachers work by saving the compiled scripts instead of parsing and re-compiling.[/quote]

Shhh.

It’s funny if we don’t know.

((I’d call it more “interpreted” each time by the server rather than “compiled”))

Read full topic

item.title: Request: Terms & Conditions page (Works like moparisthebest.com's)
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

VB7 Rocks:

That is like, an epic quote. First it’s funny, and second you don’t compile PHP.

I believe PHP scripts are compiled each time they are called. I’m not entirely sure how PHP parsers and cachers work, but I’m pretty sure PHP cachers work by saving the compiled scripts instead of parsing and re-compiling.

Read full topic

item.title: Request: Terms & Conditions page (Works like moparisthebest.com's)
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

checker script like

<?php
if(!isset( $_GET['agree'] || $_COOKIE['agree'] != "yes") {
    header("Location: tos.php");
    exit;
}
setcookie("agree", $_GET['agree']);
?>

and main index like.

<?php
if (isset($_COOKIE['agree'])) {
    if($_COOKIE['agree'] == "yes") {
        define('ROOT', './');
        include ROOT.'siteSomething.php';
    } else {
        header("Location: tos.php");
        exit;
    }
} else {
    header("Location: tos.php");
    exit;
}
?>

i wrote this so it might not compile

Read full topic
